Panel Name

fwElmbCANbusOperation.pnl
Introduction
 This panel is used for the operation of a selected CAN bus that has been created in the current system. The operation of individual ELMBs on this bus is also possible.
Instructions There are three main 'sections' to this panel (Figure 1):

Table Showing Information

There are a number of columns shown in this table. Below is a brief description of what information is shown in each column.

Elmb Name - The name given to the ELMB at creation time is dispayed

ID - The node ID of the ELMB

AI - The count of Analog Inputs that have been defined for this ELMB

AO - The count of Analog Outputs that have been defined for this ELMB

DI - The count of Digital Inputs that have been defined for this ELMB

DO - The count of Digital Outputs that have been defined for this ELMB

Bootup - The column displays the count of bootup messages that have been received from this ELMB since the last time the OPC Server was started. The timestamp of the last bootup message is also shown.

Status - This column displays the state of the ELMB. This value is updated each time a Node Guard request is sent to the ELMB, as the ELMB then responds with a message indicating this information. If the ELMB does not respond, this is indicated in this column as DISCON.

Error - The column displays the error register value that is received from this ELMB when an error occurs. The timestamp of the last update is also shown.

Send message to all nodes on the bus

Various operations are available from this section which apply to the CANbus.

Start - Clicking this button sends an NMT (Network ManagemenT) command to the CANbus that starts (or sets operational) all ELMBs.

Stop - Clicking this button sends an NMT Stop command to all ELMBs on the CANbus.

Reset - Clicking this button sends an NMT Reset command to all ELMBs on the CANbus. This will cause the ELMBs to re-boot, and therefore a bootup message should be seen from each node.

Send message to selected node

Three operations are available from this section. You must select an ELMB from the table (by clicking on the required row) before you can send a message to the ELMB.

Start - Clicking this button sends an NMT (Network ManagemenT) command to the selected ELMB that starts (or sets operational) the ELMB.

Stop - Clicking this button sends an NMT Stop command to the selected ELMB.

Reset - Clicking this button sends an NMT Reset command to the selected ELMB. This will cause the ELMB to re-boot, and therefore a bootup message should be seen from the selected node.

Sync. interval (ms) - This displays the SYNC interval (the time period between successive SYNC messages being sent to the CANbus). This value can be changed by clicking on this field, altering the value and then pressing <Enter>. As indicated, the value is given in milliseconds.

Node guard interval (ms) - This displays the Node Guard Interval (the time period between successive Node Guard messages being sent to the CANbus). Clicking on this field allows you to alter the value, and then press <Enter> for the value to be applied. As indicated, the value is given in milliseconds.

Restrictions

 

Figure 1: Elmb CANbus Operation panel

Dollar Parameters
Name Description  
$sDpName The name of the datapoint for the CANbus to be operated. Required
